page.title: 03KEMPSEY'S GENERAL STORE.
page.content: 'The Original Stores' is owned by Mr.G.W. Halford. The building is 485 years old, but the shop has been there for the last 100 years. Mr. Halford has worked at Kempsey's main shop since 1955 and has no intention of changing his job. The store sells everything from coal to videos and the shop does a fair trade. Out of the 400 customers that they get each day, the main item sold is the fruit and vegetable produce which is boughtfrom the market-gardens in and around Kempsey and other goods from cash and carry stores. The shop doesn't use electric or computerized technology as they like to work with old tills and scales. The shop is successfully fighting off the challenge of the supermarkets at the expense of Mr Halford's own holidays for the last five years.
